alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:35PM EST until December 20 at 1:20PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Androscoggin and Sagadahoc Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Androscoggin and Oxford Counties. Androscoggin River At Gorham affecting Coos and Oxford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River at Rumford. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.6 feet, This is a 100 year flood. In Mexico, flooding occurs on Riverside Avenue, Dix Avenue, Holman Avenue, Osgood Avenue, Carlton Avenue, and Flood Street. In Rumford, flooding occurs on Propect Avenue, Eaton Hill Road, Front Street, and Sunnyside Terrace. Hundreds of acres of farm fields also flood. Flooding occurs in downstream Canton, Dixfield, Jay, and Livermore Falls. Several properties surrounded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM EST Tuesday was 22.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain around 22 feet into this afternoon, then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.2 feet on 04/01/1987. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
